issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Install 1_7_x branch of Kitchen Sink on iOS device running iOS version 5.0
2. Navigate to platform>sockets>connecting sockets
3. press the connect button
4. Navigate back to sockets and let app sit ~2-3 seconds

Actual Result:
App crashes

Expected result:
App should not crash and should display table view of socket options.

*Note
Crashes on 1.7.2
fields.summary: iOS: KitchenSink - crash on iOS device running iOS version 5.0 due to connecting to a nonexistent socket
fields.environment: iOS device running iOS 5.0 (tested on iPhone 4s, iPhone4, and iPad 2), TiStudio 1.0.6.201110251616, TiMobSDK 1.7.5.v20111101114654

comments.body:
Tested on Ti Studio 1.0.7.201112061404
 Ti Mob SDK 1.8.0.1.v20111207091653
 OSX Lion
iPhone 4S OS 5.0.1

Expected behavior is shown of no crash
